author: Yucatan Times
title: Firemen rescue a man and his pet from a fire in Mérida - The Yucatan Times
text: On the morning of Wednesday, June 19, state police agents saved the lives of a person and their pet who were trapped in the middle of a fire that occurred in a home in Ciudad Cancel. Until now, officially, the causes of the fire are unknown, however, it was unofficially known that the incident could have been due to a short circuit. The fire started minutes before 8 in the morning in a house located on 77-B Street between 106 and 108 of the neighborhood, in the west of Mérida. The fire spread quickly through the house so that a man and his dog were trapped inside. The neighbors, who noticed the fire, called 911 and within minutes elements of the state police arrived and broke some window panes to carry out the rescue and save the lives of the man and his pet. Minutes later, firefighters arrived and fought the fire. Paramedics also arrived and took the person into an ambulance to treat him and, although he did not suffer physical injuries, he did have mild smoke poisoning. During the work, the police closed the street to prevent vehicle traffic and thus make the work more agile. TYT Newsroom

author: EFE
title: China registra temperaturas extremas y un nuevo récord nacional de demanda eléctrica - Mundo - ABC Color
text: Mundo China registra temperaturas extremas y un nuevo récord nacional de demanda eléctrica Pekín, 17 jul (EFE).- Las altas temperaturas que afectan a varias zonas de China han propiciado datos récord de calor en los últimos días y un nuevo máximo nacional de demanda eléctrica, que esta semana llegó por primera vez a los 1.506 millones de kilovatios, según datos oficiales. Por EFE 17 de julio de 2025 - 01:35

author: Engadget
title: Tesla robot goes haywire on engineer in Texas factory: 'Trail of blood'
text:
Fox News Tesla robot goes haywire on engineer in Texas factory: 'Trail of blood' Brianna Herlihy December 28, 2023 at 10:19 PM · 2 min read Link Copied Read full article Tesla robot goes haywire on engineer in Texas factory: 'Trail of blood'
A Tesla engineer was reportedly a victim of a bloody attack by a robot at a factory near Austin, Texas.
Recent reports revealed a 2021 injury report that claims a robot designed to move aluminum car parts pinned the engineer against a surface and dug its metal claws into his back and arm, according to witnesses who spoke to The Information in a story published last month.
After another worker hit an emergency stop button, the engineer maneuvered his way out of the robot’s grasp, falling a couple of feet down a chute designed to collect scrap aluminum and leaving a trail of blood behind him, one of the witnesses told The Information.
The attack reportedly occurred while the engineer was programming software for two disabled Tesla robots nearby.
TESLA'S OPTIMUS ROBOT FUSES SELF-DRIVING TECH WITH MIND-BLOWING HUMANLIKE CAPABILITIES
In 2022, the Tesla Texas gigafactory was subject to a federal investigation for failing to pay workers holiday, overtime and other earned wages.
READ ON THE FOX NEWS APP
Staff attorney Hannah Alexander of the Workers Defense Project told a local news outlet the unpaid wages range from a few thousand to tens of thousands of dollars.
A DIY VERSION OF TESLA’S CYBERTRUCK MADE OUT OF WOOD
"For a corporation, a hundred, a thousand or ten thousand is nothing. For a community, that is rent, the groceries for the week, the difference between paying the utilities or not," Virginia Badillo, a Workers Defense Project board member, said during a press conference last year.
The group filed complaints with the U.S. Labor Department and the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), alleging contractors and subcontractors gave some workers fake safety certificates.
ON THIS DAY IN HISTORY, JULY 10, 1856, INVENTOR NIKOLA TESLA IS BORN: 'KEEN INTEREST IN NATURE'
"Workers report that when they needed training, they were simply sent PDF files or images of certificates through text or WhatsApp in a matter of days when there’s no conceivable way workers could have even taken the training required," Alexander told KXAN news.
Original article source: Tesla robot goes haywire on engineer in Texas factory: 'Trail of blood'
